@courtland you can only watch the first game of each set without a subscription.  i highly recommend buying one, though -- the entertainment per dollar is fantastic  :)
@travhimself I bought a season ticket immediately after watching that game, then came back and saw your comment
Make that *tried* to buy a season ticket, but PayPal is cock-blocking me until I prove I live where I do, and GomTV forces you to use PayPal.
it'll spit out a link that you can open with VLC to watch on any OS
GomTV also forces you to use a PC for the live stream...
If you have a subscription, just go to the page where you click on the screen and past this:

javascript:Live.prototype.addGox=function(a,b){x(b);};live.play('HQ');function x(a){var r;x=new XMLHttpRequest();x.open('GET',a,false);x.send(null);if(x.status==200){r=x.responseText;}var m=r.match(/href="(.+)"/i);var l=decodeURIComponent(m[1]);prompt('VLC HQ',l.replace(new RegExp('&', 'g'),'&'));}

@Simeon I haven't tried @kevinflo's particular method, but there are definitely workarounds to watch the streams on a Mac or linux box.  If the JS injection doesn't work, poke around reddit and you'll find other options

I love paying for things online, but when people make it super hard and annoying to do that, it makes me love pirating. And this is coming from a guy who made a paid iPhone app that was, unfortunately, pirated by thousands...
@courtland I hear ya. But are you going to let GomTV suffer for the sins of PayPal? :) I'm sure you'll get it all worked out in time for the Ro16 games.
@fuhadr this sucks
Finally got my issues resolved with PayPal and managed to get a $10 season ticket, woo! Now to spend the next 36 hours watching StarCraft...
I feel super bad for the Code A top 8 looking to advance.  People they'll be facing in up/down matches? IMMvP, IMNestea, MarinekingPrime, SlayersBoxeR, TSL_Fruitdealer, Rainbow, and NSPGenius
This season has been pretty crazy so far.  It'll be a fun 36 hours
Code A/S/UpDown are all part of the GSL tournament.
So to make it into the later stages of the tourny, you must be in Code S.
Is there an explanation somewhere of how all this Code S/A and up-down stuff works? I get the general idea, but wouldn't be surprised if I'm missing something.
ah makes sense, thanks
So what's the end-goal? Sounds like there is going to be a tournament eventually. Do you have to be part of Code S to be in that tournament?
@dz Seriously.  Three past-season champs in the up-and-down matches?  Craziness.

Good question....  Not 100% sure myself, but basically Code S is the top tier of play, Code A is the lower tier, and Up/Down matches are "limbo".  Players that find themselves in up/down matches are playing for spots in Code S.  If they lose, they get knocked down to Code A and have to fight their way back into Code S next season.
But once we get past a certain point, Ro16 I believe, Code S is all that's left.
My pleasure.  I've asked my colleagues to make sure that's correct -- they may pop in and clarify if I made any mistakes.
There should be a code A finals as well.  I know that code A makes less money than code S.
Why are SC2 tournaments so damn complicated? What's the advantage over straight-knockout setups like Tennis/other sport championships?

Good question.  I found the GSL setup overly complex at first, too.  I think part of the reason is that there are so many talented players out there.  It broadens the field a bit.  Just think -- if there was only one tier of play, FruitDealer, NesTea, MarineKing others would already be out...
Code S players who get eliminated in the first round automatically get sent to face up/down matches with the top 16 (or something) of Code A in a group style format.
Code S is where the big money is earned. I think every player in Code S gets *some* money, mayby $500-1000. The winner of code A gets as much as a semi finalist in Code S i think.
So it gives double-chances to proven skilled players, and also the double-publicity of making them play each other at the start, and potentially the end of a tournament...
Just watched the rest of Group E, SanZenith is a beast...
They made the system the way it is to ensure that every single game has a tournament ramification
ONE LOVE, ONE DREAM, TO STAAAAND UNIIIIIITED...
THIS, IS WHY, LOVE KEEPS ME ALIIIIIIIIIIIVE
